080@Category({ MasterTests.class, MediumTests.class })
081public class TestCatalogJanitor {
082
083  @ClassRule
084  public static final HBaseClassTestRule CLASS_RULE =
085    HBaseClassTestRule.forClass(TestCatalogJanitor.class);
086
087  private static final Logger LOG = LoggerFactory.getLogger(TestCatalogJanitor.class);
088
089  private static final HBaseTestingUtility HTU = new HBaseTestingUtility();
090
091  @Rule
092  public final TestName name = new TestName();
093
094  private MockMasterServices masterServices;
095  private CatalogJanitor janitor;
096
097  @BeforeClass
098  public static void beforeClass() throws Exception {
099    ChunkCreator.initialize(MemStoreLAB.CHUNK_SIZE_DEFAULT, false, 0, 0, 0, null,
100      MemStoreLAB.INDEX_CHUNK_SIZE_PERCENTAGE_DEFAULT);
101  }
102
103  @Before
104  public void setup() throws Exception {
105    setRootDirAndCleanIt(HTU, this.name.getMethodName());
106    this.masterServices = new MockMasterServices(HTU.getConfiguration());
107    this.masterServices.start(10, null);
108    this.janitor = new CatalogJanitor(masterServices);
109  }
110
111  @After
112  public void teardown() {
113    this.janitor.shutdown(true);
114    this.masterServices.stop("DONE");
115  }
116
117  @Test
118  public void testCleanMerge() throws IOException {
119    TableDescriptor td = createTableDescriptorForCurrentMethod();
120    // Create regions.
121    HRegionInfo merged =
122      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("aaa"), Bytes.toBytes("eee"));
123    HRegionInfo parenta =
124      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("aaa"), Bytes.toBytes("ccc"));
125    HRegionInfo parentb =
126      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("ccc"), Bytes.toBytes("eee"));
127
128    List<RegionInfo> parents = new ArrayList<>();
129    parents.add(parenta);
130    parents.add(parentb);
131
132    Path rootdir = this.masterServices.getMasterFileSystem().getRootDir();
133    Path tabledir = CommonFSUtils.getTableDir(rootdir, td.getTableName());
134    Path storedir =
135      HRegionFileSystem.getStoreHomedir(tabledir, merged, td.getColumnFamilies()[0].getName());
136
137    Path parentaRef = createMergeReferenceFile(storedir, merged, parenta);
138    Path parentbRef = createMergeReferenceFile(storedir, merged, parentb);
139
140    // references exist, should not clean
141    assertFalse(CatalogJanitor.cleanMergeRegion(masterServices, merged, parents));
142
143    masterServices.getMasterFileSystem().getFileSystem().delete(parentaRef, false);
144
145    // one reference still exists, should not clean
146    assertFalse(CatalogJanitor.cleanMergeRegion(masterServices, merged, parents));
147
148    masterServices.getMasterFileSystem().getFileSystem().delete(parentbRef, false);
149
150    // all references removed, should clean
151    assertTrue(CatalogJanitor.cleanMergeRegion(masterServices, merged, parents));
152  }
153
154  @Test
155  public void testDontCleanMergeIfFileSystemException() throws IOException {
156    TableDescriptor td = createTableDescriptorForCurrentMethod();
157    // Create regions.
158    HRegionInfo merged =
159      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("aaa"), Bytes.toBytes("eee"));
160    HRegionInfo parenta =
161      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("aaa"), Bytes.toBytes("ccc"));
162    HRegionInfo parentb =
163      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("ccc"), Bytes.toBytes("eee"));
164
165    List<RegionInfo> parents = new ArrayList<>();
166    parents.add(parenta);
167    parents.add(parentb);
168
169    Path rootdir = this.masterServices.getMasterFileSystem().getRootDir();
170    Path tabledir = CommonFSUtils.getTableDir(rootdir, td.getTableName());
171    Path storedir =
172      HRegionFileSystem.getStoreHomedir(tabledir, merged, td.getColumnFamilies()[0].getName());
173    createMergeReferenceFile(storedir, merged, parenta);
174
175    MasterServices mockedMasterServices = spy(masterServices);
176    MasterFileSystem mockedMasterFileSystem = spy(masterServices.getMasterFileSystem());
177    FileSystem mockedFileSystem = spy(masterServices.getMasterFileSystem().getFileSystem());
178
179    when(mockedMasterServices.getMasterFileSystem()).thenReturn(mockedMasterFileSystem);
180    when(mockedMasterFileSystem.getFileSystem()).thenReturn(mockedFileSystem);
181
182    // throw on the first exists check
183    doThrow(new IOException("Some exception")).when(mockedFileSystem).exists(any());
184
185    assertFalse(CatalogJanitor.cleanMergeRegion(mockedMasterServices, merged, parents));
186
187    // throw on the second exists check (within HRegionfileSystem)
188    AtomicBoolean returned = new AtomicBoolean(false);
189    doAnswer(invocationOnMock -> {
190      if (!returned.get()) {
191        returned.set(true);
192        return masterServices.getMasterFileSystem().getFileSystem()
193          .exists(invocationOnMock.getArgument(0));
194      }
195      throw new IOException("Some exception");
196    }).when(mockedFileSystem).exists(any());
197
198    assertFalse(CatalogJanitor.cleanMergeRegion(mockedMasterServices, merged, parents));
199  }
200
201  private Path createMergeReferenceFile(Path storeDir, HRegionInfo mergedRegion,
202    HRegionInfo parentRegion) throws IOException {
203    Reference ref = Reference.createTopReference(mergedRegion.getStartKey());
204    long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
205    // Reference name has this format: StoreFile#REF_NAME_PARSER
206    Path p = new Path(storeDir, Long.toString(now) + "." + parentRegion.getEncodedName());
207    FileSystem fs = this.masterServices.getMasterFileSystem().getFileSystem();
208    return ref.write(fs, p);
209  }
210
211  /**
212   * Test clearing a split parent.
213   */
214  @Test
215  public void testCleanParent() throws IOException, InterruptedException {
216    TableDescriptor td = createTableDescriptorForCurrentMethod();
217    // Create regions.
218    HRegionInfo parent =
219      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("aaa"), Bytes.toBytes("eee"));
220    HRegionInfo splita =
221      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("aaa"), Bytes.toBytes("ccc"));
222    HRegionInfo splitb =
223      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("ccc"), Bytes.toBytes("eee"));
224    // Test that when both daughter regions are in place, that we do not remove the parent.
225    Result r = createResult(parent, splita, splitb);
226    // Add a reference under splitA directory so we don't clear out the parent.
227    Path rootdir = this.masterServices.getMasterFileSystem().getRootDir();
228    Path tabledir = CommonFSUtils.getTableDir(rootdir, td.getTableName());
229    Path parentdir = new Path(tabledir, parent.getEncodedName());
230    Path storedir =
231      HRegionFileSystem.getStoreHomedir(tabledir, splita, td.getColumnFamilies()[0].getName());
232    Reference ref = Reference.createTopReference(Bytes.toBytes("ccc"));
233    long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
234    // Reference name has this format: StoreFile#REF_NAME_PARSER
235    Path p = new Path(storedir, Long.toString(now) + "." + parent.getEncodedName());
236    FileSystem fs = this.masterServices.getMasterFileSystem().getFileSystem();
237    Path path = ref.write(fs, p);
238    assertTrue(fs.exists(path));
239    LOG.info("Created reference " + path);
240    // Add a parentdir for kicks so can check it gets removed by the catalogjanitor.
241    fs.mkdirs(parentdir);
242    assertFalse(CatalogJanitor.cleanParent(masterServices, parent, r));
243    ProcedureTestingUtility.waitAllProcedures(masterServices.getMasterProcedureExecutor());
244    assertTrue(fs.exists(parentdir));
245    // Remove the reference file and try again.
246    assertTrue(fs.delete(p, true));
247    assertTrue(CatalogJanitor.cleanParent(masterServices, parent, r));
248    // Parent cleanup is run async as a procedure. Make sure parentdir is removed.
249    ProcedureTestingUtility.waitAllProcedures(masterServices.getMasterProcedureExecutor());
250    assertTrue(!fs.exists(parentdir));
251  }
252
253  /**
254   * Make sure parent gets cleaned up even if daughter is cleaned up before it.
255   */
256  @Test
257  public void testParentCleanedEvenIfDaughterGoneFirst() throws IOException, InterruptedException {
258    parentWithSpecifiedEndKeyCleanedEvenIfDaughterGoneFirst(this.name.getMethodName(),
259      Bytes.toBytes("eee"));
260  }
261
262  /**
263   * Make sure last parent with empty end key gets cleaned up even if daughter is cleaned up before
264   * it.
265   */
266  @Test
267  public void testLastParentCleanedEvenIfDaughterGoneFirst()
268    throws IOException, InterruptedException {
269    parentWithSpecifiedEndKeyCleanedEvenIfDaughterGoneFirst(this.name.getMethodName(), new byte[0]);
270  }
271
272  /**
273   * @return A TableDescriptor with a tableName of current method name and a column family that is
274   *         MockMasterServices.DEFAULT_COLUMN_FAMILY_NAME)
275   */
276  private TableDescriptor createTableDescriptorForCurrentMethod() {
277    return TableDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(TableName.valueOf(this.name.getMethodName()))
278      .setColumnFamily(new HColumnDescriptor(MockMasterServices.DEFAULT_COLUMN_FAMILY_NAME))
279      .build();
280  }
281
282  /**
283   * Make sure parent with specified end key gets cleaned up even if daughter is cleaned up before
284   * it.
285   * @param rootDir    the test case name, used as the HBase testing utility root
286   * @param lastEndKey the end key of the split parent
287   */
288  private void parentWithSpecifiedEndKeyCleanedEvenIfDaughterGoneFirst(final String rootDir,
289    final byte[] lastEndKey) throws IOException, InterruptedException {
290    TableDescriptor td = createTableDescriptorForCurrentMethod();
291    // Create regions: aaa->{lastEndKey}, aaa->ccc, aaa->bbb, bbb->ccc, etc.
292    HRegionInfo parent = new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("aaa"), lastEndKey);
293    // Sleep a second else the encoded name on these regions comes out
294    // same for all with same start key and made in same second.
295    Thread.sleep(1001);
296
297    // Daughter a
298    HRegionInfo splita =
299      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("aaa"), Bytes.toBytes("ccc"));
300    Thread.sleep(1001);
301    // Make daughters of daughter a; splitaa and splitab.
302    HRegionInfo splitaa =
303      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("aaa"), Bytes.toBytes("bbb"));
304    HRegionInfo splitab =
305      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("bbb"), Bytes.toBytes("ccc"));
306
307    // Daughter b
308    HRegionInfo splitb = new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("ccc"), lastEndKey);
309    Thread.sleep(1001);
310    // Make Daughters of daughterb; splitba and splitbb.
311    HRegionInfo splitba =
312      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("ccc"), Bytes.toBytes("ddd"));
313    HRegionInfo splitbb = new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("ddd"), lastEndKey);
314
315    // First test that our Comparator works right up in CatalogJanitor.
316    SortedMap<HRegionInfo, Result> regions =
317      new TreeMap<>(new CatalogJanitor.SplitParentFirstComparator());
318    // Now make sure that this regions map sorts as we expect it to.
319    regions.put(parent, createResult(parent, splita, splitb));
320    regions.put(splitb, createResult(splitb, splitba, splitbb));
321    regions.put(splita, createResult(splita, splitaa, splitab));
322    // Assert its properly sorted.
323    int index = 0;
324    for (Map.Entry<HRegionInfo, Result> e : regions.entrySet()) {
325      if (index == 0) {
326        assertTrue(e.getKey().getEncodedName().equals(parent.getEncodedName()));
327      } else if (index == 1) {
328        assertTrue(e.getKey().getEncodedName().equals(splita.getEncodedName()));
329      } else if (index == 2) {
330        assertTrue(e.getKey().getEncodedName().equals(splitb.getEncodedName()));
331      }
332      index++;
333    }
334
335    // Now play around with the cleanParent function. Create a ref from splita up to the parent.
336    Path splitaRef =
337      createReferences(this.masterServices, td, parent, splita, Bytes.toBytes("ccc"), false);
338    // Make sure actual super parent sticks around because splita has a ref.
339    assertFalse(CatalogJanitor.cleanParent(masterServices, parent, regions.get(parent)));
340
341    // splitba, and split bb, do not have dirs in fs. That means that if
342    // we test splitb, it should get cleaned up.
343    assertTrue(CatalogJanitor.cleanParent(masterServices, splitb, regions.get(splitb)));
344
345    // Now remove ref from splita to parent... so parent can be let go and so
346    // the daughter splita can be split (can't split if still references).
347    // BUT make the timing such that the daughter gets cleaned up before we
348    // can get a chance to let go of the parent.
349    FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(HTU.getConfiguration());
350    assertTrue(fs.delete(splitaRef, true));
351    // Create the refs from daughters of splita.
352    Path splitaaRef =
353      createReferences(this.masterServices, td, splita, splitaa, Bytes.toBytes("bbb"), false);
354    Path splitabRef =
355      createReferences(this.masterServices, td, splita, splitab, Bytes.toBytes("bbb"), true);
356
357    // Test splita. It should stick around because references from splitab, etc.
358    assertFalse(CatalogJanitor.cleanParent(masterServices, splita, regions.get(splita)));
359
360    // Now clean up parent daughter first. Remove references from its daughters.
361    assertTrue(fs.delete(splitaaRef, true));
362    assertTrue(fs.delete(splitabRef, true));
363    assertTrue(CatalogJanitor.cleanParent(masterServices, splita, regions.get(splita)));
364
365    // Super parent should get cleaned up now both splita and splitb are gone.
366    assertTrue(CatalogJanitor.cleanParent(masterServices, parent, regions.get(parent)));
367  }
368
369  /**
370   * CatalogJanitor.scan() should not clean parent regions if their own parents are still
371   * referencing them. This ensures that grandparent regions do not point to deleted parent regions.
372   */
373  @Test
374  public void testScanDoesNotCleanRegionsWithExistingParents() throws Exception {
375    TableDescriptor td = createTableDescriptorForCurrentMethod();
376    // Create regions: aaa->{lastEndKey}, aaa->ccc, aaa->bbb, bbb->ccc, etc.
377
378    // Parent
379    HRegionInfo parent =
380      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("aaa"), HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY, true);
381    // Sleep a second else the encoded name on these regions comes out
382    // same for all with same start key and made in same second.
383    Thread.sleep(1001);
384
385    // Daughter a
386    HRegionInfo splita =
387      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("aaa"), Bytes.toBytes("ccc"), true);
388    Thread.sleep(1001);
389
390    // Make daughters of daughter a; splitaa and splitab.
391    HRegionInfo splitaa =
392      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("aaa"), Bytes.toBytes("bbb"), false);
393    HRegionInfo splitab =
394      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("bbb"), Bytes.toBytes("ccc"), false);
395
396    // Daughter b
397    HRegionInfo splitb =
398      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("ccc"), HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY);
399    Thread.sleep(1001);
400
401    // Parent has daughters splita and splitb. Splita has daughters splitaa and splitab.
402    final Map<HRegionInfo, Result> splitParents = new TreeMap<>(new SplitParentFirstComparator());
403    splitParents.put(parent, createResult(parent, splita, splitb));
404    splita.setOffline(true); // simulate that splita goes offline when it is split
405    splitParents.put(splita, createResult(splita, splitaa, splitab));
406
407    final Map<HRegionInfo, Result> mergedRegions = new TreeMap<>();
408    CatalogJanitor spy = spy(this.janitor);
409
410    CatalogJanitorReport report = new CatalogJanitorReport();
411    report.count = 10;
412    report.mergedRegions.putAll(mergedRegions);
413    report.splitParents.putAll(splitParents);
414
415    doReturn(report).when(spy).scanForReport();
416
417    // Create ref from splita to parent
418    LOG.info("parent=" + parent.getShortNameToLog() + ", splita=" + splita.getShortNameToLog());
419    Path splitaRef =
420      createReferences(this.masterServices, td, parent, splita, Bytes.toBytes("ccc"), false);
421    LOG.info("Created reference " + splitaRef);
422
423    // Parent and splita should not be removed because a reference from splita to parent.
424    int gcs = spy.scan();
425    assertEquals(0, gcs);
426
427    // Now delete the ref
428    FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(HTU.getConfiguration());
429    assertTrue(fs.delete(splitaRef, true));
430
431    // now, both parent, and splita can be deleted
432    gcs = spy.scan();
433    assertEquals(2, gcs);
434  }
435
436  /**
437   * Test that we correctly archive all the storefiles when a region is deleted
438   */
439  @Test
440  public void testSplitParentFirstComparator() {
441    SplitParentFirstComparator comp = new SplitParentFirstComparator();
442    TableDescriptor td = createTableDescriptorForCurrentMethod();
443
444    /*
445     * Region splits: rootRegion --- firstRegion --- firstRegiona | |- firstRegionb | |- lastRegion
446     * --- lastRegiona --- lastRegionaa | |- lastRegionab |- lastRegionb rootRegion : [] - []
447     * firstRegion : [] - bbb lastRegion : bbb - [] firstRegiona : [] - aaa firstRegionb : aaa - bbb
448     * lastRegiona : bbb - ddd lastRegionb : ddd - []
449     */
450
451    // root region
452    HRegionInfo rootRegion = new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), HConstants.EMPTY_START_ROW,
453      HConstants.EMPTY_END_ROW, true);
454    HRegionInfo firstRegion =
455      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), HConstants.EMPTY_START_ROW, Bytes.toBytes("bbb"), true);
456    HRegionInfo lastRegion =
457      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("bbb"), HConstants.EMPTY_END_ROW, true);
458
459    assertTrue(comp.compare(rootRegion, rootRegion) == 0);
460    assertTrue(comp.compare(firstRegion, firstRegion) == 0);
461    assertTrue(comp.compare(lastRegion, lastRegion) == 0);
462    assertTrue(comp.compare(rootRegion, firstRegion) < 0);
463    assertTrue(comp.compare(rootRegion, lastRegion) < 0);
464    assertTrue(comp.compare(firstRegion, lastRegion) < 0);
465
466    // first region split into a, b
467    HRegionInfo firstRegiona =
468      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), HConstants.EMPTY_START_ROW, Bytes.toBytes("aaa"), true);
469    HRegionInfo firstRegionb =
470      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("aaa"), Bytes.toBytes("bbb"), true);
471    // last region split into a, b
472    HRegionInfo lastRegiona =
473      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("bbb"), Bytes.toBytes("ddd"), true);
474    HRegionInfo lastRegionb =
475      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("ddd"), HConstants.EMPTY_END_ROW, true);
476
477    assertTrue(comp.compare(firstRegiona, firstRegiona) == 0);
478    assertTrue(comp.compare(firstRegionb, firstRegionb) == 0);
479    assertTrue(comp.compare(rootRegion, firstRegiona) < 0);
480    assertTrue(comp.compare(rootRegion, firstRegionb) < 0);
481    assertTrue(comp.compare(firstRegion, firstRegiona) < 0);
482    assertTrue(comp.compare(firstRegion, firstRegionb) < 0);
483    assertTrue(comp.compare(firstRegiona, firstRegionb) < 0);
484
485    assertTrue(comp.compare(lastRegiona, lastRegiona) == 0);
486    assertTrue(comp.compare(lastRegionb, lastRegionb) == 0);
487    assertTrue(comp.compare(rootRegion, lastRegiona) < 0);
488    assertTrue(comp.compare(rootRegion, lastRegionb) < 0);
489    assertTrue(comp.compare(lastRegion, lastRegiona) < 0);
490    assertTrue(comp.compare(lastRegion, lastRegionb) < 0);
491    assertTrue(comp.compare(lastRegiona, lastRegionb) < 0);
492
493    assertTrue(comp.compare(firstRegiona, lastRegiona) < 0);
494    assertTrue(comp.compare(firstRegiona, lastRegionb) < 0);
495    assertTrue(comp.compare(firstRegionb, lastRegiona) < 0);
496    assertTrue(comp.compare(firstRegionb, lastRegionb) < 0);
497
498    HRegionInfo lastRegionaa =
499      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("bbb"), Bytes.toBytes("ccc"), false);
500    HRegionInfo lastRegionab =
501      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("ccc"), Bytes.toBytes("ddd"), false);
502
503    assertTrue(comp.compare(lastRegiona, lastRegionaa) < 0);
504    assertTrue(comp.compare(lastRegiona, lastRegionab) < 0);
505    assertTrue(comp.compare(lastRegionaa, lastRegionab) < 0);
506  }
507
508  @Test
509  public void testArchiveOldRegion() throws Exception {
510    // Create regions.
511    TableDescriptor td = createTableDescriptorForCurrentMethod();
512    HRegionInfo parent =
513      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("aaa"), Bytes.toBytes("eee"));
514    HRegionInfo splita =
515      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("aaa"), Bytes.toBytes("ccc"));
516    HRegionInfo splitb =
517      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("ccc"), Bytes.toBytes("eee"));
518
519    // Test that when both daughter regions are in place, that we do not
520    // remove the parent.
521    Result parentMetaRow = createResult(parent, splita, splitb);
522    FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(HTU.getConfiguration());
523    Path rootdir = this.masterServices.getMasterFileSystem().getRootDir();
524    // have to set the root directory since we use it in HFileDisposer to figure out to get to the
525    // archive directory. Otherwise, it just seems to pick the first root directory it can find (so
526    // the single test passes, but when the full suite is run, things get borked).
527    CommonFSUtils.setRootDir(fs.getConf(), rootdir);
528    Path tabledir = CommonFSUtils.getTableDir(rootdir, td.getTableName());
529    Path storedir =
530      HRegionFileSystem.getStoreHomedir(tabledir, parent, td.getColumnFamilies()[0].getName());
531    Path storeArchive = HFileArchiveUtil.getStoreArchivePath(this.masterServices.getConfiguration(),
532      parent, tabledir, td.getColumnFamilies()[0].getName());
533    LOG.debug("Table dir:" + tabledir);
534    LOG.debug("Store dir:" + storedir);
535    LOG.debug("Store archive dir:" + storeArchive);
536
537    // add a couple of store files that we can check for
538    FileStatus[] mockFiles = addMockStoreFiles(2, this.masterServices, storedir);
539    // get the current store files for comparison
540    FileStatus[] storeFiles = fs.listStatus(storedir);
541    int index = 0;
542    for (FileStatus file : storeFiles) {
543      LOG.debug("Have store file:" + file.getPath());
544      assertEquals("Got unexpected store file", mockFiles[index].getPath(),
545        storeFiles[index].getPath());
546      index++;
547    }
548
549    // do the cleaning of the parent
550    assertTrue(CatalogJanitor.cleanParent(masterServices, parent, parentMetaRow));
551    Path parentDir = new Path(tabledir, parent.getEncodedName());
552    // Cleanup procedure runs async. Wait till it done.
553    ProcedureTestingUtility.waitAllProcedures(masterServices.getMasterProcedureExecutor());
554    assertTrue(!fs.exists(parentDir));
555    LOG.debug("Finished cleanup of parent region");
556
557    // and now check to make sure that the files have actually been archived
558    FileStatus[] archivedStoreFiles = fs.listStatus(storeArchive);
559    logFiles("archived files", storeFiles);
560    logFiles("archived files", archivedStoreFiles);
561
562    assertArchiveEqualToOriginal(storeFiles, archivedStoreFiles, fs);
563
564    // cleanup
565    CommonFSUtils.delete(fs, rootdir, true);
566  }
567
568  /**
569   * @param description description of the files for logging
570   * @param storeFiles  the status of the files to log
571   */
572  private void logFiles(String description, FileStatus[] storeFiles) {
573    LOG.debug("Current " + description + ": ");
574    for (FileStatus file : storeFiles) {
575      LOG.debug(Objects.toString(file.getPath()));
576    }
577  }
578
579  /**
580   * Test that if a store file with the same name is present as those already backed up cause the
581   * already archived files to be timestamped backup
582   */
583  @Test
584  public void testDuplicateHFileResolution() throws Exception {
585    TableDescriptor td = createTableDescriptorForCurrentMethod();
586
587    // Create regions.
588    HRegionInfo parent =
589      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("aaa"), Bytes.toBytes("eee"));
590    HRegionInfo splita =
591      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("aaa"), Bytes.toBytes("ccc"));
592    HRegionInfo splitb =
593      new HRegionInfo(td.getTableName(), Bytes.toBytes("ccc"), Bytes.toBytes("eee"));
594    // Test that when both daughter regions are in place, that we do not
595    // remove the parent.
596    Result r = createResult(parent, splita, splitb);
597    FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(HTU.getConfiguration());
598    Path rootdir = this.masterServices.getMasterFileSystem().getRootDir();
599    // Have to set the root directory since we use it in HFileDisposer to figure out to get to the
600    // archive directory. Otherwise, it just seems to pick the first root directory it can find (so
601    // the single test passes, but when the full suite is run, things get borked).
602    CommonFSUtils.setRootDir(fs.getConf(), rootdir);
603    Path tabledir = CommonFSUtils.getTableDir(rootdir, parent.getTable());
604    Path storedir =
605      HRegionFileSystem.getStoreHomedir(tabledir, parent, td.getColumnFamilies()[0].getName());
606    LOG.info("Old root:" + rootdir);
607    LOG.info("Old table:" + tabledir);
608    LOG.info("Old store:" + storedir);
609
610    Path storeArchive = HFileArchiveUtil.getStoreArchivePath(this.masterServices.getConfiguration(),
611      parent, tabledir, td.getColumnFamilies()[0].getName());
612    LOG.info("Old archive:" + storeArchive);
613
614    // enable archiving, make sure that files get archived
615    addMockStoreFiles(2, this.masterServices, storedir);
616    // get the current store files for comparison
617    FileStatus[] storeFiles = fs.listStatus(storedir);
618    // Do the cleaning of the parent
619    assertTrue(CatalogJanitor.cleanParent(masterServices, parent, r));
620    Path parentDir = new Path(tabledir, parent.getEncodedName());
621    ProcedureTestingUtility.waitAllProcedures(masterServices.getMasterProcedureExecutor());
622    assertTrue(!fs.exists(parentDir));
623
624    // And now check to make sure that the files have actually been archived
625    FileStatus[] archivedStoreFiles = fs.listStatus(storeArchive);
626    assertArchiveEqualToOriginal(storeFiles, archivedStoreFiles, fs);
627
628    // now add store files with the same names as before to check backup
629    // enable archiving, make sure that files get archived
630    addMockStoreFiles(2, this.masterServices, storedir);
631
632    // Do the cleaning of the parent
633    assertTrue(CatalogJanitor.cleanParent(masterServices, parent, r));
634    // Cleanup procedure runs async. Wait till it done.
635    ProcedureTestingUtility.waitAllProcedures(masterServices.getMasterProcedureExecutor());
636    assertTrue(!fs.exists(parentDir));
637
638    // and now check to make sure that the files have actually been archived
639    archivedStoreFiles = fs.listStatus(storeArchive);
640    assertArchiveEqualToOriginal(storeFiles, archivedStoreFiles, fs, true);
641  }
642
643  @Test
644  public void testAlreadyRunningStatus() throws Exception {
645    int numberOfThreads = 2;
646    List<Integer> gcValues = new ArrayList<>();
647    Thread[] threads = new Thread[numberOfThreads];
648    for (int i = 0; i < numberOfThreads; i++) {
649      threads[i] = new Thread(() -> {
650        try {
651          gcValues.add(janitor.scan());
652        } catch (IOException e) {
653          throw new RuntimeException(e);
654        }
655      });
656    }
657    for (int i = 0; i < numberOfThreads; i++) {
658      threads[i].start();
659    }
660    for (int i = 0; i < numberOfThreads; i++) {
661      threads[i].join();
662    }
663    assertTrue("One janitor.scan() call should have returned -1", gcValues.contains(-1));
664  }
665
666  private FileStatus[] addMockStoreFiles(int count, MasterServices services, Path storedir)
667    throws IOException {
668    // get the existing store files
669    FileSystem fs = services.getMasterFileSystem().getFileSystem();
670    fs.mkdirs(storedir);
671    // create the store files in the parent
672    for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
673      Path storeFile = new Path(storedir, "_store" + i);
674      FSDataOutputStream dos = fs.create(storeFile, true);
675      dos.writeBytes("Some data: " + i);
676      dos.close();
677    }
678    LOG.debug("Adding " + count + " store files to the storedir:" + storedir);
679    // make sure the mock store files are there
680    FileStatus[] storeFiles = fs.listStatus(storedir);
681    assertEquals("Didn't have expected store files", count, storeFiles.length);
682    return storeFiles;
683  }
684
685  private String setRootDirAndCleanIt(final HBaseTestingUtility htu, final String subdir)
686    throws IOException {
687    Path testdir = htu.getDataTestDir(subdir);
688    FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(htu.getConfiguration());
689    if (fs.exists(testdir)) assertTrue(fs.delete(testdir, true));
690    CommonFSUtils.setRootDir(htu.getConfiguration(), testdir);
691    return CommonFSUtils.getRootDir(htu.getConfiguration()).toString();
692  }
693
694  private Path createReferences(final MasterServices services, final TableDescriptor td,
695    final HRegionInfo parent, final HRegionInfo daughter, final byte[] midkey, final boolean top)
696    throws IOException {
697    Path rootdir = services.getMasterFileSystem().getRootDir();
698    Path tabledir = CommonFSUtils.getTableDir(rootdir, parent.getTable());
699    Path storedir =
700      HRegionFileSystem.getStoreHomedir(tabledir, daughter, td.getColumnFamilies()[0].getName());
701    Reference ref =
702      top ? Reference.createTopReference(midkey) : Reference.createBottomReference(midkey);
703    long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
704    // Reference name has this format: StoreFile#REF_NAME_PARSER
705    Path p = new Path(storedir, Long.toString(now) + "." + parent.getEncodedName());
706    FileSystem fs = services.getMasterFileSystem().getFileSystem();
707    ref.write(fs, p);
708    return p;
709  }
710
711  private Result createResult(final HRegionInfo parent, final HRegionInfo a, final HRegionInfo b)
712    throws IOException {
713    return MetaMockingUtil.getMetaTableRowResult(parent, null, a, b);
714  }
715}
